    • Field Detail

      • deviceID

        public java.lang.String deviceID
        Device ID. It is only used when PushClient connected to the server

      • groupID

        public long groupID
        Group ID registered on the database according to group key when the application push the notifications or PushClient connect to the server

      • apiID

        public long apiID
        The API ID registered on the database according to API key when the application push the notifications or PushClient connect to the server

      • database1

        public Database database1
        Primary Database object

      • database2

        public Database database2
        Secondary Database object

      • database3

        public Database database3
        Tertiary Database object

      • offlineID

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> offlineID
        Array list contains notification ID loaded when PushClient connected to the server after notification pushed

      • hashPasswordClient

        public java.lang.String hashPasswordClient
        Hash password instead of clear password and only used by PushServer. Hash password stored in the database. Both pusher and PushClient never send clear password or hash password

      • hashPasswordPusher

        public java.lang.String hashPasswordPusher
        Hash password instead of clear password and only used by PushServer. Hash password stored in the database. Both pusher and PushClient never send clear password or hash password

      • timeZone

        public java.util.TimeZone timeZone
        TimeZone object to get time zone of the PushServer.

      • timeZoneOffset

        public long timeZoneOffset
        Time zone offset of the PushServer. Pusher not necessary to send the local time. All the notification time use the local time of the PushServer

      • cachePusherSource

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> cachePusherSource
        Cache to store pusher source

    • Method Detail

      • authentication

        public boolean authentication(java.lang.String authorization)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException,
                              QueryParserException,
                              DatabaseTypeException,
                              java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        PushClient authentication
        Parameters:
        authorization - URL encoded string contains the authentication sent by PushClient
        Returns:
        true if valid and false if invalid
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if any SQL errors
        QueryParserException - if any errors while parsing
        DatabaseTypeException - if database type not supported
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if algorithm not found

      • authentication

        public boolean authentication(java.lang.String authorization,
                              java.lang.String serverAddress)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException,
                              QueryParserException,
                              DatabaseTypeException,
                              java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Pusher authentication
        Parameters:
        authorization - URL encoded string contains the authentication sent by PushClient
        serverAddress - IP address of the pusher server. It must be public static IP address. If IP address is not registered, PushServer ask administrator to validate that IP address is correct and allow to send the notification
        Returns:
        true if valid and false if invalid
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if any SQL errors
        QueryParserException - if any errors while parsing
        DatabaseTypeException - if database type not supported
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if algorithm not found

      • confirmSource

        public void confirmSource(long apiID,
                          java.lang.String serverAddress)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException,
                          DatabaseTypeException
        Confirm address in order the pusher can send the notification. This method will insert an IP address of the pusher and to be confirmed manually
        Parameters:
        apiID - API ID
        serverAddress - IP address of the pusher
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if any SQL errors
        DatabaseTypeException - if database type not supported

      • insert

        public JSONArray insert(java.lang.String body)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException,
                        JSONException,
                        DatabaseTypeException
        Insert notification
        Parameters:
        body - String contains JSONObject of the notification. Pusher only send one notification message to PushServer but possible to send it to several devices
        Returns:
        JSONArray of JSONObject contains notification ID and destination device ID
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if any SQL errors
        DatabaseTypeException - if database type not supported
        JSONException

      • delete

        public JSONArray delete(java.lang.String body)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException,
                        JSONException,
                        DatabaseTypeException
        Delete notification stored in the database
        Parameters:
        body - String contains JSONArray of pairs of notification ID and device ID. Pusher must send notification ID and device that will be deleted. PushServer only will delete the notification if notification ID, device ID and API ID is match
        Returns:
        JSONArray contains notification ID and device ID of the deletion
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if any SQL errors
        DatabaseTypeException - if database type not supported
        JSONException

        deviceID - Device ID

        groupID - Group ID
        Returns:
        JSONArray contains notification ID and device ID of the deletion
